protocol_name: RNA Imaging with MERFISH - Sample Preparation and Staining
protocol_name_html: RNA Imaging with MERFISH - Sample Preparation and Staining
description: The preparation and staining of samples for MERFISH follows closely the typical protocols used for smFISH (Raj et al., 2008). However, there are a few places in which we have modified these protocols to optimize MERFISH staining. Again, RNase contamination can destroy samples, so care should be taken to work in an RNase-free environment.

materials.reagent_name: Please see Before starting section for required materials

manuscript_citation: Jeffrey R. Moffitt, Xiaowei Zhuang. RNA Imaging with Multiplexed Error Robust Fluorescence in situ Hybridization. Methods Enzymol. 2016; 572: 1–49. doi: 10.1016/bs.mie.2016.03.020

groups.group_name: Human Cell Atlas Method Development Community

keywords: In situ hybridization; RNA; Single cells; Single molecules; Single-molecule imaging; Transcriptomics

collections.protocol_name: RNA Imaging with Multiplexed Error Robust Fluorescence in situ Hybridization
collections.protocol_name_html: RNA Imaging with Multiplexed Error Robust Fluorescence in situ Hybridization

guidelines:
The protocol workflow is as follows: 

 

1. Fixation and Permeabilization of Cells (Steps 1-5)

 

The first step in most FISH protocols is to fix the cells and then to permeabilize the membrane using either an overnight incubation in 70% ethanol or a brief exposure to surfactant. We prefer the latter approach since this protocol requires less time; however, we have had reasonable performance with both approaches.  

 

 

2. Hybridization of Encoding Probes (Steps 5-23) 

 

 

This protocol will require the following reagents and buffers:

 

1. Fixation buffer (4% PFA in 1XPBS)

  • 1 mL 32% paraformaldehyde (PFA; Electron MicroscopySciences; 15714)
  • 0.8 mL 10X Phosphate Buffered Saline (PBS; Ambion; AM9625)
  • 6.2 mL nuclease-free water
  • Store at −20°C in single use aliquots

 

2. Permeabilization buffer (0.5% v/v Triton X-100 in 1XPBS)

  • 5 mL 10X PBS
  • 45 mL nuclease-free water
  • 250 μL Triton X-100 (Sigma; T8787)
  • Store at room temperature

 

3. 2X SSC buffer

  • 5 mL 10X PBS
  • 45 mL nuclease-free water
  • 250 μL Triton X-100 (Sigma; T8787)
  • Store at room temperature

 

4. 1X PBS buffer

  • 5 mL 10X PBS
  • 45 mL nuclease-free water
  • Store at room temperature

 

5. 20% w/v Dextran sulfate

  • In an RNase-free bottle (such as an empty nuclease-free water bottle), mix the following
  • 100 g dextran sulfate (Fisher Scientific; bp1585100)
  • 300 mL nuclease-free water
  • Stir with a stir bar cleaned with D/RNaseFree while heating gently on a hot plate (37 °C) until dissolved
  • Add nuclease-free water to produce a 500 mL total volume
  • Store at room temperature

 

6. Encoding probe hybridization buffer

  • 300 μL 100% deionized formamide (Ambion; AM9342)
  • 500 μL 20% w/v dextran sulfate (above)
  • 100 μL 20X SSC
  • 90 μL nuclease-free water
  • 1 mg yeast tRNA (Life Technologies; 15401-011)
  • 10 μL 200 mM Vandyl Ribonucleoside Complex (VRC; New England Biolabs; S1402S)
  • Store at −20°C

 

7. Encoding probe wash buffer

  • 15 mL 100% deionized formamide
  • 5 mL 20X SSC
  • 29.5 mL nuclease-free water
  • 0.5 mL 200 mM VRC
  • Store at 4°C in the dark and use within a few days

 

8. 40-mm diameter, No. 1.5 coverslips (Bioptechs; 40-1313-0319)

9. 60-mm diameter, Cell culture petri dish (Corning; 353802)

10. 1” x 3” microscope slides

11. Parafilm (VWR; 52858-076)

12. Orange FluoSphere carboxylate-modified beads, 0.1-um-diameter (ThermoScientific; F-8800)

 

 

This protocol requires the following equipment: 

 

1. Equipment for cell culture

2. 37°C incubator

3. 47°C incubator

4. Laboratory rocker
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data: Fixation and Permeabilization of Cells
components.name: Section

components.data: Culture cells on a suitable coverglass. The culture substrate for cells should be the same coverglass that will be used for imaging. We utilize 40-mm diameter No. 1.5 coverslips from Bioptechs since these coverslips fit within the flow chamber that we use for imaging. We typically culture cells in sterile, 60-mm-diameter petri dishes with one coverslip placed in the bottom of each dish.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Culture cells on a suitable coverglass. The culture substrate for cells should be the same coverglass that will be used for imaging. We utilize 40-mm diameter No. 1.5 coverslips from Bioptechs since these coverslips fit within the flow chamber that we use for imaging. We typically culture cells in sterile, 60-mm-diameter petri dishes with one coverslip placed in the bottom of each dish.

components.data: Fixation and Permeabilization of Cells
components.name: Section

components.data: Fix cells. Allow the fixation buffer described in the Before Starting section to warm to room temperature. Aspirate culture medium from cells then gently decant 2-3 mL of fixation buffer into the petri dish that holds the coverslip. Cover and rock gently for 15 minutes at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Fix cells. Allow the fixation buffer described in the Before Starting section to warm to room temperature. Aspirate culture medium from cells then gently decant 2-3 mL of fixation buffer into the petri dish that holds the coverslip. Cover and rock gently for 15 minutes at room temperature.

components.data: Fixation and Permeabilization of Cells
components.name: Section

components.data: Aspirate the fixation buffer and gently decant 2-3 mL of 1X PBS into the petri dish to wash the cells. Immediately aspirate this buffer. Repeat this 1X PBS wash for a total of three times.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Aspirate the fixation buffer and gently decant 2-3 mL of 1X PBS into the petri dish to wash the cells. Immediately aspirate this buffer. Repeat this 1X PBS wash for a total of three times.

components.data: Fixation and Permeabilization of Cells
components.name: Section

components.data: Permeabilize the cells. Aspirate any residual 1X PBS from the petri dish and decant 2-3 mL permeabilization buffer into the petri dish. Incubate the cells at room temperature with gentle rocking for 2 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Permeabilize the cells. Aspirate any residual 1X PBS from the petri dish and decant 2-3 mL permeabilization buffer into the petri dish. Incubate the cells at room temperature with gentle rocking for 2 minutes.

source_data.title: Incubation at RT while gentle rocking

components.data: Fixation and Permeabilization of Cells
components.name: Section

components.data: Aspirate out the permeabilization buffer and wash the cells three times with 1X PBS as described in Step 3.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Aspirate out the permeabilization buffer and wash the cells three times with 1X PBS as described in Step 3.

components.data: Hybridization of Encoding Probes
components.name: Section

components.data: Exchange buffer on cells. Aspirate any residual 1X PBS, and gently decant 2-3 mL of room temperature encoding probe wash buffer into each petri dish. Rock the sample at room temperature for 5 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Exchange buffer on cells. Aspirate any residual 1X PBS, and gently decant 2-3 mL of room temperature encoding probe wash buffer into each petri dish. Rock the sample at room temperature for 5 minutes.

source_data.protocol_name: RNA Imaging with MERFISH - Sample Preparation and Staining
source_data.protocol_name_html: RNA Imaging with MERFISH - Sample Preparation and Staining
source_data.annotation: This step insures that any residual buffer left on the coverslip will not significantly dilute the formamide in the hybridization buffer in the next step.
source_data.thread_text: This step insures that any residual buffer left on the coverslip will not significantly dilute the formamide in the hybridization buffer in the next step.
source_data.body: This step insures that any residual buffer left on the coverslip will not significantly dilute the formamide in the hybridization buffer in the next step.

components.data: Hybridization of Encoding Probes
components.name: Section

components.data: Add hybridization buffer with probes. Place a layer of fresh parafilm on a 1” x 3” microscope slide. Dilute the encoding probes made in the Probe Construction protocol into Encoding Probe Hybridization Buffer to the desired concentration, typically somewhere between 10 and 200 μM depending on the number of unique encoding probes in the probe set.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add hybridization buffer with probes. Place a layer of fresh parafilm on a 1” x 3” microscope slide. Dilute the encoding probes made in the Probe Construction protocol into Encoding Probe Hybridization Buffer to the desired concentration, typically somewhere between 10 and 200 μM depending on the number of unique encoding probes in the probe set.

components.data: Hybridization of Encoding Probes
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 30 μL of this probe solution to the parafilm surface.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 30 μL of this probe solution to the parafilm surface.

components.data: Hybridization of Encoding Probes
components.name: Section

components.data: Aspirate any residual encoding probe wash buffer from the coverslip and gently place the coverslip, cell-side-down, onto the droplet of encoding probes. Press gently to create a thin layer of encoding probe.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Aspirate any residual encoding probe wash buffer from the coverslip and gently place the coverslip, cell-side-down, onto the droplet of encoding probes. Press gently to create a thin layer of encoding probe.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 9 of RNA Imaging with merFISH - Sample Preparation and Staining
source_data.protocol_name: RNA Imaging with MERFISH - Sample Preparation and Staining
source_data.protocol_name_html: RNA Imaging with MERFISH - Sample Preparation and Staining
source_data.annotation: The probe concentration needs to be optimized for each probe set: Higher probe concentrations produce brighter spots but a higher level of non-specifically bound probe background. We recommend titrating the concentration of probe across a ~40-fold concentration range (5 – 200 μM) to identify the concentration that produces the clearest signal relative to the background. We find that the optimal probe concentration only needs to be established once per probe set.
source_data.thread_text: The probe concentration needs to be optimized for each probe set: Higher probe concentrations produce brighter spots but a higher level of non-specifically bound probe background. We recommend titrating the concentration of probe across a ~40-fold concentration range (5 – 200 μM) to identify the concentration that produces the clearest signal relative to the background. We find that the optimal probe concentration only needs to be established once per probe set.
source_data.body: The probe concentration needs to be optimized for each probe set: Higher probe concentrations produce brighter spots but a higher level of non-specifically bound probe background. We recommend titrating the concentration of probe across a ~40-fold concentration range (5 – 200 μM) to identify the concentration that produces the clearest signal relative to the background. We find that the optimal probe concentration only needs to be established once per probe set.

components.data: Hybridization of Encoding Probes
components.name: Section

components.data: Incubation. Create a humidity chamber by pouring nuclease-free water into the base of an old pipette tip box.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubation. Create a humidity chamber by pouring nuclease-free water into the base of an old pipette tip box.

components.data: Hybridization of Encoding Probes
components.name: Section

components.data: Place the sample within this box and seal with parafilm.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the sample within this box and seal with parafilm.

source_data.annotation: The sample will be sitting on the upper plastic level and should not come into contact with the water reservoir below.
source_data.thread_text: The sample will be sitting on the upper plastic level and should not come into contact with the water reservoir below.

components.data: Hybridization of Encoding Probes
components.name: Section

components.data: Place this box into a 37 °C incubation chamber and incubate for at least 12 hours.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place this box into a 37 °C incubation chamber and incubate for at least 12 hours.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 12 of RNA Imaging with merFISH - Sample Preparation and Staining
source_data.protocol_name: RNA Imaging with MERFISH - Sample Preparation and Staining
source_data.protocol_name_html: RNA Imaging with MERFISH - Sample Preparation and Staining
source_data.annotation: In some cases, we find that longer incubations (~36 hours) increase the quality of staining. Again, we recommend varying the incubation time for each probe set to identify the optimal incubation time.
source_data.thread_text: In some cases, we find that longer incubations (~36 hours) increase the quality of staining. Again, we recommend varying the incubation time for each probe set to identify the optimal incubation time.
source_data.body: In some cases, we find that longer incubations (~36 hours) increase the quality of staining. Again, we recommend varying the incubation time for each probe set to identify the optimal incubation time.

components.data: Hybridization of Encoding Probes
components.name: Section

components.data: Wash away residual encoding probes. Preheat 6 mL of encoding probe wash buffer per sample to 47 °C in a water bath.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash away residual encoding probes. Preheat 6 mL of encoding probe wash buffer per sample to 47 °C in a water bath.

source_data.title: Encoding probe wash buffer per sample

components.data: Hybridization of Encoding Probes
components.name: Section

components.data: Slowly peel the coverslip off of the microscope slide taking care not to crack the coverslip. If it appears to be stuck, immerse the assembly in a layer of encoding probe wash buffer for 5 minutes to loosen.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Slowly peel the coverslip off of the microscope slide taking care not to crack the coverslip. If it appears to be stuck, immerse the assembly in a layer of encoding probe wash buffer for 5 minutes to loosen.

components.data: Hybridization of Encoding Probes
components.name: Section

components.data: Place the coverslip, cell-sideup, in a fresh 60-mm-diameter petri dish and add 3 mL of preheated encoding probe wash buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the coverslip, cell-sideup, in a fresh 60-mm-diameter petri dish and add 3 mL of preheated encoding probe wash buffer.

components.data: Hybridization of Encoding Probes
components.name: Section

components.data: Place the petri dish in a 47-°C incubator for 30 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the petri dish in a 47-°C incubator for 30 minutes.

components.data: Hybridization of Encoding Probes
components.name: Section

components.data: Aspirate the encoding probe wash buffer, add 3 mL of fresh encoding probe wash buffer, and repeat the 30-minute, 47-°C incubation.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Aspirate the encoding probe wash buffer, add 3 mL of fresh encoding probe wash buffer, and repeat the 30-minute, 47-°C incubation.

components.data: Hybridization of Encoding Probes
components.name: Section

components.data: Aspirate the wash buffer and wash the sample in 2X SSC by adding 3 mL of 2X SSC and then immediately aspirating this buffer. Repeat this SSC wash for a total of three times.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Aspirate the wash buffer and wash the sample in 2X SSC by adding 3 mL of 2X SSC and then immediately aspirating this buffer. Repeat this SSC wash for a total of three times.

components.data: Hybridization of Encoding Probes
components.name: Section

components.data: Addition of fiducial beads. Prepare a 100X solution of fluorescent beads by adding 10 μL of 0.1-nm-diameter Orange Fluospheres beads to 10 mL 2X SSC. Vortex to mix. This stock solution can be stored at 4 °C in the dark for several months. Further, dilute this stock solution 1 to 100 in 2X SSC to create 3 mL of bead solution for each sample.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Addition of fiducial beads. Prepare a 100X solution of fluorescent beads by adding 10 μL of 0.1-nm-diameter Orange Fluospheres beads to 10 mL 2X SSC. Vortex to mix. This stock solution can be stored at 4 °C in the dark for several months. Further, dilute this stock solution 1 to 100 in 2X SSC to create 3 mL of bead solution for each sample.

components.data: Hybridization of Encoding Probes
components.name: Section

components.data: Aspirate the 2X SSC from the samples and add the bead solution to each petri dish. Gently rock at room temperature for 15 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Aspirate the 2X SSC from the samples and add the bead solution to each petri dish. Gently rock at room temperature for 15 minutes.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 20 of RNA Imaging with merFISH - Sample Preparation and Staining
source_data.protocol_name: RNA Imaging with MERFISH - Sample Preparation and Staining
source_data.protocol_name_html: RNA Imaging with MERFISH - Sample Preparation and Staining
source_data.annotation: We choose orange-colored beads (561-nm excitation) because we prefer to use the red imaging channel (641-nm excitation) for our smFISH images; however, the color of these beads could be changed to suit different imaging demands. We aim to have ~20 beads per field of view; thus, if different beads are used, the concentration should be adjusted to produce a similar final density of beads on the sample.
source_data.thread_text: We choose orange-colored beads (561-nm excitation) because we prefer to use the red imaging channel (641-nm excitation) for our smFISH images; however, the color of these beads could be changed to suit different imaging demands. We aim to have ~20 beads per field of view; thus, if different beads are used, the concentration should be adjusted to produce a similar final density of beads on the sample.
source_data.body: We choose orange-colored beads (561-nm excitation) because we prefer to use the red imaging channel (641-nm excitation) for our smFISH images; however, the color of these beads could be changed to suit different imaging demands. We aim to have ~20 beads per field of view; thus, if different beads are used, the concentration should be adjusted to produce a similar final density of beads on the sample.

components.data: Hybridization of Encoding Probes
components.name: Section

components.data: Post-fixation. To fix the fiducial beads in place and to prevent subtle changes in the shape of the cell induced by the repeated washing that will occur in the MERFISH Imaging protocol, we perform an additional fixation of the samples. Aspirate the bead solution and add 3 mL of fixation buffer prewarmed to room temperature to each petri dish.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Post-fixation. To fix the fiducial beads in place and to prevent subtle changes in the shape of the cell induced by the repeated washing that will occur in the MERFISH Imaging protocol, we perform an additional fixation of the samples. Aspirate the bead solution and add 3 mL of fixation buffer prewarmed to room temperature to each petri dish.

components.data: Hybridization of Encoding Probes
components.name: Section

components.data: Gently rock the sample at room temperature for 10 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Gently rock the sample at room temperature for 10 minutes.

components.data: Hybridization of Encoding Probes
components.name: Section

components.data: Aspirate the fixation buffer, and wash the sample three times with 2X SSC.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Aspirate the fixation buffer, and wash the sample three times with 2X SSC.

source_data.annotation: If the sample was prepared in an RNase-free environment, it can now be stored in 2XSSC at 4°C for several days. We do not recommend prolonged storage.
source_data.thread_text: If the sample was prepared in an RNase-free environment, it can now be stored in 2XSSC at 4°C for several days. We do not recommend prolonged storage.
source_data.body: If the sample was prepared in an RNase-free environment, it can now be stored in 2XSSC at 4°C for several days. We do not recommend prolonged storage.
